items.sentence: Tom is more of an acquaintance than a friend.
I can\'t believe you didn\'t want to do that.
I can\'t figure out why you don\'t like jazz.
I can\'t tell you how much we\'ve missed you.
Do you want me to bring you something to eat?
Tom told Mary that he was going to kill John.
I think it\'s unlikely Tom will ever do that.
I saw Tom smoking behind the school building.
I think Tom is the one who drew this picture.
I usually have a glass of milk for breakfast.
I told Tom he didn\'t have to talk so loudly.
I told Tom how much I valued Mary\'s opinion.
I told Tom to clean his room, but he didn\'t.
Let\'s forget that this whole thing happened.
I promise I\'ll come by to see you on Monday.
Tom didn\'t say anything about what happened.
Tom didn\'t tell Mary he was already married.
There was nobody else in the room except Tom.
There was nothing that Tom could do about it.
I liked Tom, but I wasn\'t really his friend.
